block.p: That the state of poverty in America is far bleaker than official reports have indicated (''Counting the Poor,'' editorial, April 17) should be a wake-up call for all. Those who work every day to fight poverty know that when government, nonprofit, corporate and philanthropic sectors join forces, dramatic change happens.

That the state of poverty in America is far bleaker than official reports have indicated (''Counting the Poor,'' editorial, April 17) should be a wake-up call for all. Those who work every day to fight poverty know that when government, nonprofit, corporate and philanthropic sectors join forces, dramatic change happens.

To end poverty requires a national commitment. In this pivotal presidential election campaign already under way, all candidates must talk about how their leadership will serve to end homelessness, joblessness and despair for so many Americans, and tell us how their administration should be measured for its progress in reversing this human tragedy in the world's richest nation.
Homeland security goes hand in hand with economic security and opportunity.
Lawrence Mandell President and C.E.O. United Way of New York City New York, April 17, 2007
